segments.text: I see the woman is so focused on drying that plate, she doesn't notice the water overflowing or the children's mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is making such a mess, but she doesn't seem to care, which is annoying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she should really turn off the faucet and clean up the water before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is being so sneaky, climbing up to get those cookies from the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit worried for him; that stool looks really unstable and dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her cookie, looking so patient and hopeful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water is just pouring and pouring, making everything slippery and messy on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take for the woman to notice the mess and the children taking cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice and peaceful compared to the chaos inside the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope no one gets hurt with all this water on the floor and the unstable stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit anxious just watching the boy balance like that on the stool, reaching for the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR
